text:
hey y’all. one of my colleagues has a parent-child theme situation (parent purchased from marketplace), and there’s an update to the parent theme. we’ve been so burned in the past by updating wordpress themes and finding so many thing suddenly broken — is that as much of a concern with HubSpot? if we update and find stuff broken, how do we roll back?

my only experience w parent-child themes is with stuff i’ve built myself off of the boilerplate, so I’m not much help to him here.

If theme don't have any major updates, child theme must work properly.

I would recommend to ask the parent theme developer about the details of update.

HubSpot doesn't seem to have a built in way to rollback a previous version. So if it was me, I would build all pages with a child theme. And also download a copy of the marketplace theme via cli. Update the theme. Test if anything breaks see if you can isolate the cause and use your local copy of theme to override the new files by placing them in your child theme.
But I would do this on non peak time. Because you might have things broken while you fix.
As soon as something breaks.... The CEO is visiting the site.
Have you reached out to the theme developer? We get questions like this very frequently and can help customers understand the implications of the update.
I’ve asked him to. I think he’s doing that now.

Hey all, i'm having a issue where my themes stylings isn't going to all of my child pages. Some pages have them via inline css while the ones that don't are inheriting styling from main-head.min.css. ANy idea how to force the pages to inherit? There's no difference at all between the pages and the template files, so Im thinking it's some kind of cache error?

Hey everyone! Anyone know if you can set the core heading module styles in a theme template? Of course, the tag type and value can be set, but what about padding, font-size, etc? Zero documentation for this... that I can find at least.

Hello Team,
I'm having an issue where I want to display different headers on pages means on the Homepage I want to use with Black background and on the Contact page want to use transparent header.

Here Header module is the Global module.

1. use css variables to control the color scheme of header
2. put a regular custom page settings module on your template
3. use that module to override the header variables on a page level basis
Thank you <@U3T21PDBK> for the quick solution, Is there any documentation about these steps?
